channel.title: Comments on: The Six Things You Need To Know About Babel 6

item.title: By: CÃ©sar
item.dc:creator: CÃ©sar
item.description: I'm trying to render my website on oldies IE with babel-preset-es2015-loose. I've installed it using npm and added to the babel presets of package.json. For some reason I'm still unable to watch the site. Althoug it's perfect on Chrome, Firefox and IE Edge. Any idea?
item.content:encoded:
I’m trying to render my website on oldies IE with babel-preset-es2015-loose. I’ve installed it using npm and added to the babel presets of package.json.
For some reason I’m still unable to watch the site. Althoug it’s perfect on Chrome, Firefox and IE Edge.
Any idea?

item.title: By: Andy Pai
item.dc:creator: Andy Pai
item.description: Good man James! Thanks for writing this! Really helped me out.
item.content:encoded: Good man James! Thanks for writing this! Really helped me out.

item.title: By: Josh H
item.dc:creator: Josh H
item.description: It's worth mentioning Stage 0 is not required to access decorators or async/await as suggested in this article. But Stage 1, however, is.
item.content:encoded: It’s worth mentioning Stage 0 is not required to access decorators or async/await as suggested in this article. But Stage 1, however, is.

item.content:encoded: Wow! thank you JAMES K NELSON! very helpful notes, i have felling like a dumb looking in babeljs.io why i can’t make it works. Happy new year dude and good job!

item.title: By: thun
item.dc:creator: thun
item.description: I'm not sure about #6. You should be using either babel-polyfill or babel-runtime. They are mutually exclusiveâ€”unless of course you know what you are doing. But they are essentially the same thing. These are just helpers. babel-polyfill achieves the same goal by mutating globals whereas babel-runtime does so modularly. Unless you are developing a library, I'd recommend you use the polyfill. On another note, exter-helpers plugin is there to reduce helper method duplication in babel-polyfillâ€”NOT babel-transform. Babel transform reduces helper method duplication internally. So a plugin is not needed.
item.content:encoded: I’m not sure about #6. You should be using either babel-polyfill or babel-runtime. They are mutually exclusiveâ€”unless of course you know what you are doing. But they are essentially the same thing. These are just helpers. babel-polyfill achieves the same goal by mutating globals whereas babel-runtime does so modularly. Unless you are developing a library, I’d recommend you use the polyfill. On another note, exter-helpers plugin is there to reduce helper method duplication in babel-polyfillâ€”NOT babel-transform. Babel transform reduces helper method duplication internally. So a plugin is not needed.

item.title: By: James K Nelson
item.dc:creator: James K Nelson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-six-things-you-need-to-know-about-babel-6/#comment-3974">m_gol</a>.
Good point. I'll update the guide to mention uninstalling instead of deleting. Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to m_gol.

Good point. I’ll update the guide to mention uninstalling instead of deleting. Thanks!
